text: I am a millenial, apparently I’m into emojis - here is an obligatory emoji :jon-m: it is me, as an emojii

hi everyone, i have a customer which has their german website on <http://domain.de|domain.de> and their international sites on <http://domain.de/pl|domain.de/pl>  and <http://domain.de/fr|domain.de/fr>  and so on. This site is based on typo3. Now they want to move the international sites (<http://domain.de/fr|domain.de/fr> for example) to HubSpot while still having <http://domain.de|domain.de> on a server that has Typo3 as CMS. Is this possible?
i need an emoji
yes.
so i would just need to redirect, for example <http://domain.de/fr|domain.de/fr> to HubSpot?
<https://www.provintl.com/>
example
so they are on different servers?
nope
all under one HubSpot instance
BUT its better if you make the urls the same for equal pages
sp
<http://domain.com/en/contact-us|domain.com/en/contact-us>
<http://domain.com/pl/contact-us|domain.com/pl/contact-us>
<http://domain.com/fr/contact-us|domain.com/fr/contact-us>
it works better
i know that this is not a good idea the customer came up with this and asked me to find out if this is possible
other wise you have to do funny things with the menus
they want to move the international ( and way smaller sites ) first to HS while leaving the rest on typo3
after a while they want to move the rest
but HubSpot has a built in internationalization tool
its bad practice
i know i know :slightly_smiling_face:
we are trying to tell them they should move in one go
if you did that you would have to something more like this
they just want to know if it is even possible to spilt this up
<http://fr.domain.com/contact-us|fr.domain.com/contact-us>
so this is only possible with a subdomain?
because you cant split a root domain umongst multiple servers
that is what i thought
ok, we will tell them this, thanks a lot
:thumbsup_all:
I may be missing something, but, is there a way to translate a form? Or do you have to create an entirely new form? :thinking_face:

I know you can change the language settings for forms. But if you want a version in english and another in spanish, you have to have two separate ones, right? Seems like there should be a way to say if it’s this url: <http://mx.domain.com/contact-us|mx.domain.com/contact-us> then use the spanish translation. If it’s <http://us.domain.com/contact-us|us.domain.com/contact-us>, then it would default to the one in english. I don’t know how this would effect analytics, but it sure would make things easier. :thinking_face:
maybe add to the <#CGVAY1VQU|multi-language> channel?
and if doesnt exist, <#C26E7JT8V|ideas>
<@UD53A9UUR> Thanks :slightly_smiling_face: I didn’t know we had a multilanguage channel :sweat_smile:
Yup!

So our client has the HubSpot CMS (standalone) with Marketing Starter, I am noticing they dont get blog subscriptions with this even though the blog functionality is part of the CMS, is this correct? (<@U3VN3LMME> tagging you for the CMS relation)

BUG??  Anyone else experiencing this bug right now? It seems like it just started happening.  Custom modules that have a group with the “Repeater Option” on are suddenly not working.

I’ve checked multiple modules on multiple portals.  Anyone else experiencing this?
